WorkItem.Description:
Loading my holy priest works fine and i have no errors what so ever i am running windows 7 x64 professional, upon loading my death knight every time i receive this:
 
Unhandled exception has occurred in your application.
 
Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less then the size of the collection
 
See the end of this message for details on invoking 
just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.
 
************** Exception Text **************
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection.
Parameter name: startIndex
   at System.Globalization.CompareInfo.IndexOf(String source, String value, Int32 startIndex, Int32 count, CompareOptions options)
   at System.Globalization.CompareInfo.IndexOf(String source, String value, Int32 startIndex)
   at Rawr.ItemToolTip.get_CachedToolTipImage()
   at Rawr.ItemToolTip.Show(Character character, ItemInstance item, ItemInstance[] characterItems, CharacterSlot slot, IWin32Window window, Point point)
   at Rawr.ItemToolTip.Show(Character character, ItemInstance item, IWin32Window window, Point point)
   at Rawr.ItemButton.ItemButton_MouseEnter(Object sender, EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseEnter(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ButtonBase.OnMouseEnter(EventArgs eventargs)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ButtonBase.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Button.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)
 
// REMOVED RIDICULOUS EXTRA ERROR TEXT, DON'T POST THAT CRAP
WorkItem.Summary: [DPSDK] Unhandled exception upon loading dk from armory

Comments.Message:
Who's your DK?  
DPS or Tank?
We've seen this tooltip problem, but haven't been able to repro.

Thanks.
Dps dk named gilessa on us hyjal
my dps dk on us hakkar named ferid is producing the same error, it occurs the most on both characters when trying to change sigil's

I'm experiencing this as well, on Vista x64. It happens whenever I mouse over Sigil of Virulence or the Rune of the Fallen Crusader enchant.

I'm thinking it might be an issue with the version of .NET that is bundled with 64-bit Vista/Win7, as I cannot reproduce it on my XP system.
